intro: Paronychia kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish nail grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East, particularly Turkey and Iran. The plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Paronychia kurdica is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
